page.title: 09LEUCHARS CHURCH
page.content: Leuchars church stands on a hill in the middle of the village. The Normandy tower which was built in 1187 is the oldest part. The newer front was built in 1587. The minister takes regular services every Sunday. The congregation averages about 85 people. The minister also takes services at Balmullo and Guardbridge. He has been working there for about 2\ years and so he has not been aware of any real changes throughout Leuchars. One of the historical happenings attached to the church is about a man caled McKenzie who requested that his pets be buried with him in the graveyard. However, there was a snag. The church authoroties would not allow this to take place. So instead he was buried along with his pets, opposite the church manse. You can still see his grave today.
